title: South Crocker Mountain
text:
South Crocker Mountain is a <a href="mountain">mountain</a> located in <a href="Franklin%20County%2C%20Maine">Franklin County</a>, <a href="Maine">Maine</a>. South Crocker Mountain is flanked to the north by <a href="Crocker%20Mountain%20%28Maine%29">Crocker Mountain</a>, and to the southwest by <a href="Mount%20Redington">Mount Redington</a>.
The northeast and southeast faces of South Crocker Mountain drain into the <a href="South%20Branch%20Carrabassett%20River">South Branch</a> of the <a href="Carrabassett%20River">Carrabassett River</a>, which flows into the <a href="Kennebec%20River">Kennebec River</a>, and into the <a href="Gulf%20of%20Maine">Gulf of Maine</a>. The west face of South Crocker drains into Nash Stream, thence into the <a href="South%20Branch%20Dead%20River">South Branch of the Dead River</a>, <a href="Flagstaff%20Lake%20%28Maine%29">Flagstaff Lake</a>, the <a href="Dead%20River%20%28Kennebec%20River%29">Dead River</a>, another <a href="tributary">tributary</a> of the Kennebec.
The <a href="Appalachian%20Trail">Appalachian Trail</a>, a <a href="National%20Scenic%20Trail">National Scenic Trail</a> from <a href="Georgia%20%28U.S.%20state%29">Georgia</a> to <a href="Maine">Maine</a>, traverses the summit of South Crocker Mountain, running north along the ridge to Crocker, and east across Caribou Valley to <a href="Sugarloaf%20Mountain%20%28Franklin%20County%2C%20Maine%29">Sugarloaf Mountain</a>.
